data.title: Obituaries for 5-22-20
data.text:
John Carter

Mr. John Carter ,63, of Pine Bluff, Arkansas, passed away Thursday, May 14, 2020. He was born on December 31, 1956, to the late John and Mildred Carter in Pine Bluff, Arkansas.

John graduated from Pine Bluff High School. He worked at U.S. Steel for over 20 years, where he served as a former supervisor and quality control inspector.

He leaves to cherish a wife, Dorothy; five children, six sisters, ten grandchildren, and two great grandchildren, as well as a host of nieces, nephews, and cousins.

Viewing will be 3:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. Friday, May 22, 2020, at Brown Funeral Home Pine Bluff, Arkansas. A graveside service will be 10:30 a.m. Saturday, May 23, 2020, at the Cedar Grove Section of Graceland Cemetery by Pastor Robert Robinson. Services are entrusted to Brown Funeral Home of Pine Bluff, AR. After graveside service the family will be located at 901 Rock Street, White Hall Arkansas, 71602. www.brownfuneralhomeandmortuary.com.

Pearline Harris

Mrs. Pearline Harris, 70, of Pine Bluff, Arkansas, left her earthly home for her heavenly home on May 15, 2020. Mrs. Harris was born on March 06, 1950, in Sherrill, Arkansas.

She is preceded in death by her parents, O. D. Kirklin, Sr. and Edna E. Jackson-Kirklin; brothers

Johnny R. Kirklin and Roy Dean Kirkland.

She leaves to cherish her memories: husband, Mr. Charles J. Harris, Sr.; children Yolanda M. Long (Edward), Charles J. Harris, Jr. (Marisa), and Bridgette Harris; brothers Guss Riddles, O.D. Kirkland, Jr., Carl Kirkland, Sr. (Shirley), Earnest Franklin (Brenda), Calvin Kirklin (Theresa), James Kirklin (Phyllis), Jesse Kirkland, and Larry Kirklin (Valarie); sisters Dorothy Lederman, Pamela Kirklin, Juvana Kirklin, and Becky Kirklin; grandchildren, Charles J. Harris, III, Joshua Holloway, Trenton Harris, and Madison Holloway; a host of uncles, aunts, nieces, nephews, brother-in-laws, sister-in-laws, and other relatives and friends.

A walk through visitation will be held Friday, May 22, 2020, from 5:30pm - 7:00pm at Brown Funeral Home. Funeral services will be Saturday, May 23, 2020 at 11:30 AM at Brown Funeral Home. Due to CDC regulations, seating will be limited and everyone is asked to adhere to wearing protective coverage and practicing social distancing. For online condolences, please visit www.brownfuneralhomeandmortuary.com.

Natasha Nolden

Ms. Natasha Ann Nolden 43, of Pine Bluff, Arkansas, passed away Monday, May 11, 2020. Viewing will be 4:15 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. Saturday, May 9, 2020, at Brown Funeral Home Pine Bluff, Arkansas. Services are entrusted to Brown Funeral Home of Pine Bluff, AR. www.brownfuneralhomeandmortuary.com.

Ella Haines

Ella Mae Hall Haines, 84, of Rison, passed away Wednesday, May 20, 2020. She was born July 20, 1935 in Fulton, Arkansas, to the late Alva and Jessie May Hardin.

Ella was reared and educated in Tamo, Arkansas and graduated from Linwood High School. She worked as a salesperson for Illinois Tool before her retirement.

Ella was preceded in death by her parents; her first husband, Dennis Hall; her second husband, Keith Haines; one daughter, Denise Ballenger; and three siblings, Alvin, Martha and Bill.

Survivors include her children, Dennis Hall (Ruby), Vickie Webb (Joe), and Tommy Hall (Sherri); eight grandchildren; seven great grandchildren; and one sister, Mary Dandy.

Graveside Service will be 10:00 AM Saturday, May 23, 2020, at Memorial Park Cemetery with Rev. Jimmy Herring officiating. In lieu of flowers, the family has requested memorials to St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital - Attn: Tribute Department, PO Box 1000, Department 142, Memphis, Tennessee 38148. Online condolences at www.ralphrobinsonandson.com.

Tolliver Lewis III

Tolliver Lee Lewis III, 14, of Pine Bluff, Arkansas passed away. Funeral service will be at 12:00p.m. on Saturday, May 23,2020 at Forest Lawn Memorial Gardens by Paradise Funeral Home of Pine Bluff.

Visitation hour will be May 22,2020 from 5:00p.m.-7:00pm at Paradise Funeral Home. Due to the COVID 19, and in accordance with both state and federal mandates, we will only allow 5 at a time for public visitation. Once those 5 exit, another 5 will be allowed to enter the facility. ” Only Paradise Can Serve You Better!”

Vata Gullette

Vata Lashawn Gullette, 47, of Pine Bluff, Arkansas passed away May 17,2020. Funeral service will be at 10:00a.m. on Saturday, May 23,2020 at Forest Lawn Memorial Gardens by Paradise Funeral Home Pine Bluff.

Visitation will be from 7:00p.m.-8:00p.m. at Paradise Funeral Home. Due to the COVID 19, and in accordance with both state and federal mandates, we will only allow 5 at a time for public visitation. Once those 5 exit, another will be allowed to enter the facility. “Only Paradise Can Serve You Better!”

Baby Boy Kingston Shavers

Baby Boy Kingston Lamar Shavers was born May 14, 2020, and died May 14,2020. Memorial service will be 4:00p.m. on Saturday May 23,2020 at Paradise Funeral Home Chapel. “Only Paradise Can Serve You Better!”
